botanical_details.genus: Begonia can be annuals, evergreen or deciduous perennials or shrubs, with fibrous, tuberous or rhizomatous roots and usually asymmetrical leaves, often strikingly patterned, and small or large flowers, both male and female in the same cluster

how_to_grow.cultivation: Under glass grow in light, well-drained loam-based or loam-less potting compost in bright filtered light with shade from hot sun at a minimum of 17°C. Water moderately when in growth and apply a balanced liquid fertiliser at alternative waterings. To encourage compact growth, pinch out the growing tips twice during the growing season. See Begonias: houseplants for further advice.
how_to_grow.propagation: Propagate by leaf cuttings or softwood cuttings
how_to_grow.pests: May be attacked by caterpillars, mealybugs, thrips and vine weevils
how_to_grow.diseases: May be subject to powdery mildews, stem rot and rhizome rot
